summary: Senior Construction Manager EPCM Safety/Mitigation, JSA, rules, regulations, work procedures and emergency response. Design, Standards, Land Development, Infrastructure, Wet and Dry (PGE/SCE) utilities, Road Paving/Engineering, Caltrans/Public Works, Permits and Traffic Control. Twenty+ years experience on a team oriented, multi-disciplinary environment in the commercial, industrial and residential field. Professional experience ensuring time, cost effectiveness and liability minimization of personnel, equipment and material by estimating, reviewing plans, submittals/RFI, approving bid packages, proposals, RWO, WO and CO. Coordinate and schedule all phases of construction, safety, erosion control, land development, infrastructure, shut downs, tie ins, paving/road and environmental solutions. Forward planning, grading, CPUC: G.O. 95, 128 and rule 20, street utility improvements, bond release and final Fire Dept. inspections to start the reimbursement and building occupancy process for a number of developments. Track record of estimating, proposing and bringing complex construction and land development projects with up to $225M and 200+ employees, fleet of heavy equipment and material from conception to completion within budget and on time.

experience.title: Senior Construction Project Manager
experience.description: EPCM, safety/mitigation, JSA, rules/regulations, design standards, land development, infrastructure, utilities, road paving/engineering, permits and traffic control. Managed projects up to $225M with 200+ employees, scheduling, bid packages, submittals, RFI, RWO, WO and CO; coordination across all phases.

experience.title: Project Manager
experience.description: Residential/Public Works and Commercial projects in California; managed subcontractors, inspections, permits, submittals, RFIs; grading, underground wet/dry utilities, road paving/engineering; coordinated with city/building departments and Fire Dept for final inspections.

experience.title: Project Manager
experience.description: Raptor Rain Forest environmental/remediation, land development and construction projects; supervised ~$125M projects with 200+ employees; managed structures, process equipment, underground utilities, road construction and environmental materials handling.

experience.title: Assistant Project Manager
experience.description: Highway, Bridge/Underpass design-built project with CALTRANS; coordination and inspections with subcontractors; submittals, change orders, RFI's, contract administration; oversight for Santa Barbara freeway/bridge work.

experience.title: Assistant Superintendent
experience.description: Commercial Oxnard project; supervision of TILT-UP structures; safety oversight; surveying and grading support; coordination of grading, underground wet/dry utilities and site development.
